website_summaries.verdict: True to Merrell shoe tradition, the Moab Adventure Laces are comfortable footwear that function well, whether used as lifestyle shoes or as a walking/hiking ones. The shoes are perfect in width, durable, contain excellent arch support, and come with grippy soles.They are also lightweight and completely comfy right out of the box. The only real drawback is that the colors can be slightly different from their pictures online.
pros: Most people who’ve tried on the Merrell Moab Adventure Lace sneakers say they love the all-day comfort
Many reviewers call the Moab Adventure Lace sneakers “well-made” because of the solid but flexible construction
Several buyers of the low-top footwear have praised the perfect fit
Plenty of users like the design of the Merrell low-tops
They added that the leather construction, non-boot style eyelets, and standard looking laces make the shoes look less like a hiker
The lifestyle footwear has “awesome arch support,” say some purchasers
A few individuals have mentioned how durable the Merrell Adventure Moab Lace shoes are
A pleased user has noted how grippy the soles of these shoes from Merrell are
One person is delighted with the lightweight feel and breathability of the casual shoes
A consumer has recounted how happy he was with the shoes’ excellent price
A purchaser has mentioned that the Adventure Moab Lace shoes need no breaking in and are comfy right out of the box
cons: A few people have reported that the shoes’ colors are a bit off from what is pictured
The toe area of these classic Moab iterations is a bit narrow says one person

customer_reviews.title: Great fit but Faulty
customer_reviews.text: I ordered pair at 7.5, half a size larger than normal as I have a wide foot Merrells are usually too narrow for my feet, but these shoes are perfect for me. Update on Merrells I did't get round to using them until some time after buying them, when I did I notice on the first time when I wore them that the right shoe was slipping off the heal, I inspected the shoe and notice that part of the heal collar was missing, i was a bit too late to send them back. now I think that these shoes were seconds, so I have now reduced my rating to one star. shoes now heading to the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Balloch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived 2 days early, well packaged. I've been looking for this type of walking 'shoe' for quite a while. Saw in "Been Outdoors" but didn't have my size and were not helpful. Took a chance looking in Amazon. There are £20.00 less expensive via Amazon??? Did a short 4 mile walk initially but found painful in a toe, but have persivired and now ok. They are Saturday and s good fit. I'm usually a 7.5 but bought an 8. It's not posdinle6to wear thick socks, I'd suggest order 1 size up if you intend to wear thick walking socks. I've now ordered same but in black.
customer_reviews.author: Person of interest ?

customer_reviews.title: No grip on wet pavement at all.
customer_reviews.text: Order at least half a size larger than you require, one whole size larger if you plan on wearing thick hiking socks. They are comfortable but serious issues on hard, wet surfaces. I purchased these for a 3 city Portugal trip. I was constantly slipping on the wet pavement and needing to walk around manhole covers due to the complete lack of stickiness of the soles.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wright

customer_reviews.title: Poor sizing.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that at this price I would get more comfort but unfortunately not. I always take a standard size 9 so expected a good fit but this is too small. I also feel them to be somewhat over padded making them quite hot on a walk. I wish I had ordered a 9.5 they would have been better, its hard to judge wearing them for a short time indoors, the only true test is a long walk then of course its too late to return them so £80 wasted. Cannot recommend sadly.
customer_reviews.author: wj

customer_reviews.title: Good rugged walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Not a good idea to buy shoes on line unless you have previously purchased the same ones and know how they fit. I was a little disappointed in the way they felt and if I had tried them on in a shop I would not have purchased them but because I didn’t want the bother of returning them I have persisted with them and have grown to like them as they ‘wear in’.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Owen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, check size fit, no tongue, appears strong.
customer_reviews.text: Well made walking shoe, comfortable fit but I find I need at least a half size larger with Merrell than my casual shoe fit. The tongue is not sealed so they not best suited for damp conditions - star deduction. Uppers could pass for casuals. Anticipate getting some good use out of these with appropriate maintenance as I have with other Merrells.
customer_reviews.author: H J.

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I wear merrell a lot and decided to try these for the colour and design. I bought a half size bigger than I wear with other brands, as usual with merrell that extra half size makes all the difference, they fit perfectly and are very comfortable and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: stevey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Merrell Fit
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time fan of Merrell footwear having had about 5/6 pairs over the years. Size UK 10 fits me perfectly straight out of the box every time. The quality of these 'Moab' Adventure hikers throughout is top notch. Nice flexible soft leather with the always reliable Vibram sole and a very good build quality. Excellent would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HFS

customer_reviews.title: Vastly overpriced
customer_reviews.text: From Merrel you would expect comfort and soft sole walking, they are hard on the soles. They are too tight no width at all. Made in Vietnam. To be honest I bought these on sale but the sale price was £45 over priced. Really disappointed with a big name for Hiking shoes. I will never buy online again for a Hiking shoe just the current climate I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Ward

customer_reviews.title: Tight  Fit
customer_reviews.text: Very tight and narrow compared to my normal fitting. Needed to go a size up. Well made and light. Fine shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jigger

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn merrall shoes for years. I find them lightweight, fairly breathable and think this style is a great blend of casual /smart (particularly in black, which i have as well)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Merrell. Enough said.
customer_reviews.text: Slightly disappointed at the lack of a bellows tongue and the large space the tongue has to fill. The Vibram sole grips well on loose ground but can be slippery on smooth wet surfaces. Well finished and apart from the above gripes a good shoe
customer_reviews.author: Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes with extreme comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, and ok waterproofing so far. They fit well, and the soles are really bouncy. Only issue, as with all Meryll's, is the soles are slippy for UK surfaces. So need to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: SiF

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable, practical and well made shoes. I am glad I bought a half size larger than I usually buy, after reading other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Milner

customer_reviews.title: Wear them anywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Merrells are my day to day footware. I order size 10, though my size with other manufacturers is 9.5, and I find them very comfortable and equally at home on city streets as on rough ground. Unfortunately, as often happens with fashion items, I find that styles have changed when I come to reorder. These have an “all leather” look, unlike previous purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Dr John Patching

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing
customer_reviews.text: I'e always bought Merrells, but these were a disapointment - they are very narrow and hurt my feet. Too late for a refund on Amazon so sold them on Ebay
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - but small fit
customer_reviews.text: I've owned loads of merrell shoes, and these are very comfortable and high quality like all the others. they're a bit small though, I usually take a Uk10, and had to get these in a UK11.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Comfy casual walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a modern comfortable all-weather shoe. It's a wee bit on the small size, but a half size up was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Good looking outdoor shoe
customer_reviews.text: I followed the comments and ordered a half size up. A very good looking comfortable shoe. I have a thinnish foot so a wide fitting may not find it so comfortable. Also I have not yet taken them up in the hills, but them seem well made and apart from no bellows tongue I have no reason to suspect that they won't be waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Nutcracker

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes and prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very happy with the shoes. The fit is just right. The shoes are comfortable for walking -- like trainers but look a bit nicer so can be worn for social outings as well as for walks.
customer_reviews.author: LVD

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Usual Merrel quality. Nice finish and quite suitable for leisure occasions and approach. Better support than equivakent Salamons
customer_reviews.author: MR K J Pither

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Normally take a uk10. These fitted right out of the box. Very comfortable. I have an arthritic ankle and these give great support. Would recomend.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Order one size up
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of these shoes But I take sixe nine normally and if available a nine and a half I ordered nine and a half but after wearing for about two hours they made my toes sore as my toes were touching the toe of the shoe Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfy as I have plantar fasciitis and need some padded support in the heel, which these shoes have automatically, with no need for insoles.
customer_reviews.author: k childs

customer_reviews.title: Ver durable and look nice.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the wrong size but they still fit. Water proofing is great and the souls of the shoe are very grippy. I'm glad I ordered in November 2019.
customer_reviews.author: hal9000

customer_reviews.title: They’re more in the style of a low rise boot and a perfect fit. If you’re a size 9 then order ...
customer_reviews.text: Lovely walking and hiking shoes. They’re more in the style of a low rise boot and a perfect fit. If you’re a size 9 then order a 9.5 with thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Colour much darker than expected
customer_reviews.text: Shoes arrived promptly but overall disappointed as shoes were much darker in colour than expected, almost blackish brown. This isn’t covered by the Returns promise so would cost a lot to return. This is my first experience of buying shoes on Amazon and has put me off doing so again.
customer_reviews.author: Flossy

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Lovely shoes as always from Merrells. But sized different to the fabric shoes. Normally a 10 but in these 10.5 Hope this is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good but with limited life.
customer_reviews.text: This will be my third pair of these shoes. I like the fit and feel. My only downside - and it is pretty important - is that the stitching on the front/side panel has come undone on each of the last two pairs. I get about 8 months heavy use and then it comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Clark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, practical and look good
customer_reviews.text: I find Moabs comfortable and this pair look good enough for casual wear while also being solid with a good sole.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Selby

customer_reviews.title: Love Merrell
customer_reviews.text: My second pair in this style so I knew the exact size to order. I take an 11 shoe, but these are 12 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. RM Claxton

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality item
customer_reviews.text: The heel collapsed after wearing for half a dozen times. Have you ever attempted to return anything to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Chestrefeldian

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable straight out the box
customer_reviews.text: Comfy out of the box, look decent and not badly priced for what they are. People are saying to go 0.5 size higher and I normally vary between 8 and 9 depending on make. The 8.5 is a perfect fit for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than other Merrels
customer_reviews.text: I've bought lightweight Merrels which fit perfectly. Thinking they'd use the same last for all their shoes I got the same size in these warmer ones, but the are definitely Narrower than my other Merrels
customer_reviews.author: Joakim V.

customer_reviews.title: Buy half a size larger than your normal size.
customer_reviews.text: Well made by a company with a long pedigree of making specialist walking foot wear. I have never been disappointed with any Merrell purchase I have made.
customer_reviews.author: David Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Silent to squeaky in two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable boots, not quite waterproof but certainly splash proof. Unfortunately, after two weeks of wear, something in the sole has detached, making the shoes horrendously squeaky. There's nothing visibly wrong, but the noise is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, comfortable and hard wearing. Shame the tongue is only mesh as it noticeably lets moisture in
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I buy Merrell because they always fit, are almost indestructible and are well made and stylish. My latest purchase is no different.
customer_reviews.author: Pete D

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, warm and waterproof walking shoe. Use them everyday walking in varied terrain ( fields/muddy paths etc ) with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Reliably comfy
customer_reviews.text: My third pair... very supportive yet comfortable... I wear them as robust work shoes for my gardening and outdoors diy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replacement pair like for like - delighted they haven't changed
customer_reviews.author: Bunt

customer_reviews.title: I would walk five hundred miles
customer_reviews.text: Great walking shoes. I’ve only purchased a new pair as the sole on my original shoes has worn down after many miles. Good fit too. Very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Far too small. Very uncomfortable. Very heavy. Bad product. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Conner

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as past Merrells I've had when you first put them on. Not as flexible
customer_reviews.author: Barry Elsom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality Too small for size 8.5 Did not like surface of the uppers
customer_reviews.author: Ian Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: Need a size up.
customer_reviews.text: A comfy product that I use for day to day activity. Just need to buy a size larger than you think you are.
customer_reviews.author: Mr L

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very good in the wet kept my feet nice and cosy and dry.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent look and feel, great price for a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as I needed some new walking shoes and have always liked Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: The size is not correct - Wrong size it says EU41 but its EU39
customer_reviews.text: The size is not correct - Wrong size it says EU41 but its EU39
customer_reviews.author: DR Luis Vaz Henriques

customer_reviews.title: Smart and comfortable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking boots just right for long hikes, comfortable and smart.
customer_reviews.author: Parry Ahmedzai

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good strong walking shoe that fits well and is really comfortable to walk in.
customer_reviews.author: stephen keating

customer_reviews.title: comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a good general purpose shoe well made Merrell standard
customer_reviews.author: Keith Robson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic...
customer_reviews.text: I received this order in Portugal imn 24 h...congratulations .....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I buy a pair a year to keep me walking.
customer_reviews.text: The Moab suits me better than others tried, so I stick with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. W. Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: A good-looking comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great walking shoe. The comfort factor is very high, and the look is delightfully low-key - making them excellent for every-day casual wear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab Adventure Lace' Low Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: Get all-day comfort with the same out-of-the-box fit you expect from moab. This mid delivers a lifestyle look, waterproofing, and traction you can trust.
